document.docAuthor: Liang, Feiyang, Dai, Yuting, Yue, Lu, Li, Fasheng & Liu, Xingyue
document.masterDocTitle: DNA barcoding and taxonomic review of the barklouse genus Stenopsocus (Psocoptera: Stenopsocidae) from Taiwan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: DNA barcoding and taxonomic review of the barklouse genus Stenopsocus (Psocoptera: Stenopsocidae) from Taiwan

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stenopsocus externus
Banks, 1937
: 259
. Type locality: China ( Taiwan : Taihoku).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. This species is characterized by the antenna with yellowish scape and pedicel, whitish 10â€“13 segments of antenna, and yellowish pterostigma with narrow brown stripe on the half of posterior margin.

Adult male. Body (
Fig. 9
a) length 2.41 mm , length from postclypeus to wing tip 4.13 mm . IO: 0.38 mm , d: 0.28 mm , IO/d= 1.36 , f 1 : 0.71 mm , f 2 : 0.55 mm , f 3 : 0.45 mm , FWL: 3.21 mm , FWW: 1.10 mm , HWL: 2.38 mm , HWW: 0.72 mm , t 1 : 0.35 mm , t 2 : 0.13 mm .

Colour (in alcohol). Head (
Figs. 9
b, c) dark brown, vertex with a yellowish subtrapezoid area, frontal area yellowish brown, antenna with yellowish scape and pedicel, and 10â€“13 segmenst whitish. Postclypeus blackish brown, labrum laterally much paler, apex of maxillary palpus pale brown, remaining segments of maxillary palpus whitish.
Thorax brown or dark brown. Leg yellowish; hind leg with yellowish brown tibia. Abdomen whitish. Genital segments dark brown.

Forewings (
Fig. 9
d) transparent. R and R 1 dark brown, anterior margin of pterostigma yellowish, other veins brown. Yellowish pterostigma with brown stripe on half of R 1 . Hindwing (
Fig. 9
e) immaculate.

Genitalia (
Figs. 10
aâ€“d) strongly sclerotized. Epiproct (
Fig. 10
b) subtriangular with a round apex. Paraproct entire sclerotized, with 30 trichobothria. Endophallus (
Fig. 10
d) strongly sclerotized, external parameres robust, with some punctures on broadened apex, not exceeding apex of aedeagal arch; aedeagal arch narrow. Hypandrium (
Fig. 10
c) strongly sclerotized.

Adult female. Body (
Fig. 9
b) length 3.16 mm , length from postclypeus to wing tip 4.48 mm . IO: 0.55 mm , d: 0.20 mm , IO/d= 2.75 , f 1 : 0.89 mm , f 2 : 0.70 mm , f 3 : 0.58 mm , FWL: 3.21 mm , FWW: 1.04 mm , HWL: 2.38 mm , HWW: 0.65 mm , t 1 : 0.32 mm , t 2 : 0.12 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Stenopsocus externus
. a. male, habitus; b. male, frontal view of head; c. male, dorsal view of head; d. male, forewing; e. male, hind wing female. f. female, habitus; g. female, frontal view of head; h. female, dorsal view of head; i. female, forewing; j. female, hind wing female. Scale bar = 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 10.
Stenopsocus externus
. a. male, genitalia, lateral view; b. male, epiproct; c. male, hypandrium; d. male, endophallus; e. female, genitalia, lateral view; f. female, epiproct; g. female, subgenital plate; h. female, gonapophyses; i. spermathecal sac. Scale bar = 0.05 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Colour generally similar to male, but slightly darker. Head (
Figs. 9
g, h) with a yellowish area on vertex. Forewing (
Fig.
9
i), R without marking, half of R 1 with dark brown marking, and hindwing (
Fig. 9
j) immaculate. Abdomen purplish brown; genital segments blackish brown.

Genitalia (
Figs. 10
eâ€“i) strongly sclerotized. Epiproct (
Fig. 10
f) subtriangle with round apex. Paraproct (
Fig. 10
e) with 19 trichobothria. Gonapophyses (
Fig. 10
h) with external valve reduced, trapezoid, fused with dorsal valve; ventral valve narrowly elongate, with acute apex. Subgenital plate (
Fig. 10
g) with sclerotized area separated into two parts, an obvious sclerotized stripe along margin of subgenital plate to connect two parts.

Distribution. China (Fujian, Gansu, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hebei, Heâ€™nan, Hubei, Huâ€™nan, Sichuan, Shanghai, Taiwan , Zhejiang); Vietnam (Kon Tum).

Remarks. In the original description,
Banks ( 1937 )
only recorded
S. formosanus
and
S. externus
from Taiwan . Subsequently,
Li ( 2002 )
recorded
S. formosanus
from Zhejiang and
S. externus
from several provinces in mainland China , i.e. Fujian, Gansu, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hebei, Hubei, Hunan, Sichuan, Shanghai. Here we record
S. externus
from Vietnam for the first time.

Based on the concept of
Banks ( 1937 )
,
S. formosanus
and
S. externus
can be distinguished based on the antennal colour and forewing marking patterns.
S. externus
has yellowish pedicel and scape, and it has a brown marking only along half of R 1 ;
S. formosanus
has dark brown antenna, and it has a brown marking along entire R 1 . Although, the interspecific genetic divergence between these two species is 0.00%, the genitalia of
S. externus
differ from those of
S. formosanus
by the subtriangle male epipcrot and the entire sclerotized paraproct. Thus, we still consider they are different species.
